intro: Rojasimalva tetrahedralis, commonly known as the tetrahedral rojasimalva, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant features showy, four-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
